properties.areaDesc: Logan, AR; Conway, AR; Pope, AR; Newton, AR; Yell, AR; Johnson, AR; Searcy, AR; Van Buren, AR
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:23PM CST until January 11 at 1:15AM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Eastern Logan County in western Arkansas...
Southeastern Johnson County in western Arkansas...
Southwestern Searcy County in north central Arkansas...
Southeastern Newton County in north central Arkansas...
Northwestern Van Buren County in north central Arkansas...
North central Conway County in central Arkansas...
Central Yell County in central Arkansas...
Pope County in central Arkansas...

* Until 115 AM CST.

* At 1021 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. Up to two inches of rain have
already fallen. Additional heavy rainfall is likely. Flash
flooding is likely to occur.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Russellville...                   Clarksville...
Danville...                       Dardanelle...
Atkins...                         Pottsville...
Lamar...                          Dover...
Ola...                            London...
Knoxville...                      Hector...
Blue Mountain...                  Lake Dardanelle State Park...
Witts Spring...                   Rocky Hill...
Moore...                          Dabney...
Bohannon...                       Jerusalem...
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 1:15 AM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
